captions.text:
So you've been wearing a super fun glitter
manicure but now it's time to remove it, and

if you're like me, you're dreading taking
the glitter off.

You've got two choices--- you can soak a cotton
ball with liquid remover and then scrub it

over your nail until you decide you're never
using glitter ever again

or you could take out a bunch of cotton balls,
rip them all up into smaller pieces, take

out a sheet of tinfoil and cut it up into
a bunch of different squares, soak the cotton

balls in liquid remover, and then wrap up
your fingers and wait.

but what if there was a brand new way to remove
glitter without all of those materials and
all the hassle?

well, there's a brand new product on the market
with super cute packaging that i just recently

tried and i'm really excited to share it with
you today. it's the first ever acetone gel

remover called no-rub by nail aid and inside
the tub you'll find a ton of pink gel for
many uses.

to use it, all you have to do is stick your
nail into the gel, close the jar, and then

wait four minutes. and now it's time for some
magical fast forwarding. so for this demo,

i'm just using one nail to show you guys,
but if i was removing the glitter from all

10 of my nails, i would do one hand first
and then do the other one after.

the simply take a paper towel and press it
starting at the cuticle and move left to right

and you slide it down the entire nail. if
you have any leftover, it should come off

while you're washing your hands right after.
pretty cool huh?

i should also mention that there's a second
jar too and it's for dark polish. so yeah,

this stuff not only removes glitter polish,
but regular ones and also nail art!

so now you're probably wondering where you
can find them. well if you live in the US

you can find them at your local walmart for
under four dollars. or if you want to order

online, or if you live in canada like me,
you can find them at norubgel.com and i'm

sure we'll be seeing no-rub in even more stores
soon since it's such a great product.

hopefully you found this video helpful and
it'll encourage you not to be so afraid of
removing your pretty glitter polishes.
take care and ill seeya next time!

title: NEW & EASIER Way to Remove Glitter Nail Polish?!
